comment.author: 92693047@N06
comment._content: Wyangala Dam on the Lachlan River, east of Cowra, in central NSW, was constructed under the British migration scheme. It was to serve a total of 1,357, 000 acres and the first sod was turned in December 1928. Trove, the site of the National Library of Australia’s collection of newspapers, gives a list of references to Wyangala Dam. trove.nla.gov.au/list?id=34539
